metadata.title: CVE-2024-26969 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: clk:qcom: gcc-ipq8074: fix terminating of frequency table arrays The frequencytable arrays are supposed to be terminated with an empty element. Add suchentry to the end of the arrays where it is missing in order to avoidpossible out-of-bound access when the table is traversed by functions likeqcom_find_freq() or qcom_find_freq_floor(). Only compile tested.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26969` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-189-generic - 5.4.0-189.209~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-189-lowlatency - 5.4.0-189.209~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-189.209~18.04.1').
